exercises.title: Introduction to Scratch
exercises.description: Learn the basics of Scratch programming by creating a simple animation.
steps: Open Scratch and create a new project.
Choose a sprite from the library.
Add a backdrop to your stage.
Use the 'when green flag clicked' block to start your animation.
Add movement blocks to make your sprite move across the stage.
exercises.exampleCode:
when green flag clicked
move 10 steps
wait 1 second
turn 15 degrees

exercises.title: Creating a Simple Game
exercises.description: Build a basic game where the player controls a sprite to collect items.
steps: Add a sprite for the player and another for the collectible item.
Use the 'when [arrow key] pressed' block to move the player sprite.
Add a condition to check if the player sprite touches the collectible item.
Increase the score when the player collects the item.
exercises.exampleCode:
when [up arrow] key pressed
change y by 10
if <touching [Collectible]> then
change [score] by 1

exercises.title: Making a Story
exercises.description: Create an interactive story using Scratch.
steps: Start a new project in Scratch.
Choose characters and backgrounds for your story.
Use the 'say' block to make characters speak.
Add 'wait' blocks to control the timing of dialogue.
Use 'broadcast' blocks to switch between scenes.

exercises.title: Animating a Character
exercises.description: Animate a character to make it look like it's walking.
steps: Select a sprite that represents a character.
Create multiple costumes for the walking animation.
Use the 'next costume' block in a loop to animate the character.
Add sound effects to enhance the animation.
